Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that has no water, depicting it as wilted or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant that has no light, depicting it as wilted or not growing well.
The student can identify and label most of the parts of the plant that help it take in water and light, like roots and leaves.
The student can highlight differences in the drawings to show patterns between plants with and without water and light.
The student can mostly use their drawings to explain that plants need water and light to live and grow, although explanations may be brief or lack depth.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit the labeling of less obvious plant parts, such as stamens or other non-primary structures. (student focuses on main parts like leaves and roots)

The student might show some inconsistencies or oversimplification in how the plant exhibits changes due to lack of water or light, such as all plants appearing equally wilted regardless of the missing element. (student might not differentiate well between effects of no water vs. no light)
There could be minor inaccuracies in the nuances of drawing wilting or color changes when plants lack water or light, such as not dramatizing the impact enough.
